message.content:
{"id": "49890", "title": "Bug 49890 Nio Selector issue on Linux platform", "description": "Bug 49890 Nio Selector issue on Linux platform.

Reproduced with the following Java versions: 1.6.007, 1.6.018, 1.6.021.

Attached is the file 'NioEndpoint.java' and a simple web application.

Sometimes the server's CPU reaches 100% and continues to stay at 100% until the server is restarted.

This issue seems to be a duplicate of Bug 46373.

It appears that the Jetty team has fixed a similar problem, as mentioned here: 'http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel'.

To aid in diagnosing the problem, I have added some logging to NioEndpoint.java.", "OB": "The logging shows that sometimes selector.select(timeout) returns zero keys on the Linux platform.", "EB": "To reproduce this JVM bug, multiple requests need to be made to the web application (e.g., press F5 in the browser and hold the button).", "SR": ""}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '49890', 'title': 'Bug 49890Nio Selector issue on linux platform', 'description': "Bug 49890Nio Selector issue on linux platform Created attachment 25997 [details]NioEndpoint.java and simple web applicationsometimes ,server's cpu reaches 100%,and keep 100% all the time,until restartthe server.Reproduced with java versions: 1.6.007,1.6.018, 1.6.021.It is duplicate of issue: Bug 46373.It seams that Jetty guys fixed that problem: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel.I added some logging to NioEndpoint.java. ", 'OB': 'With this logging we can see that selector.select(timeout) sometimes return zero keys on linux plutform. ', 'EB': 'To reproduce jvm bug we should do several requests(we can just press F5 in browser and hold button) to web application. ', 'SR': ''}
